"Fifty years ago people in America were getting very excited by the conversion from black and white television to colour television," Eric Schmidt says. And computing was about building computers that had 1 megbyte, and that was the size of a small room. He refers to Moore's Law, which describes the long-term trend that computing capability doubles every 18 months to two years. "Now, the maths of that is interesting," he says

Michael Vick , 30, was selected to start Sunday after leading the NFC with more than 1.5 million votes, far ahead of Minnesota Vikings running back Adrian Peterson , the NFC's second-leading vote-getter at 948,410.
